ext_descriptions.ext_description: A material_conductivity_classification lists the classification types of the material conductivity.
specifies that material is conductive;
specifies that material is resistive;
specifies that material is semi conductive;
specifies that material is non conductive;
A relationship_operation lists the operations of the relationship.
specifies the "and" operation;
specifies the "derived from" operation;
specifies the "or" operation;
An Inspection_requirement_occurrence is a type of that specifies a production inspection related requirement. An Inspection_requirement_occurrence may be a or a or a .

ext_description.p: A Constraint_occurrence is a type of that limits possible solutions to the requirements specification by identifying boundary conditions for any potential solution. A Constraint_occurrence may be a .
ext_description.note:
A constraint is simply a logical relation among several unknowns (or variables), each taking a value in a given domain. A constraint thus restricts the possible values that variables can take, it represents some partial information about the variables of interest. For instance, "the circle is inside the square" relates two objects without precisely specifying their positions, i.e., their coordinates. Now, one may move the square or the circle and he or she is still able to maintain the relation between these two objects. Also, one may want to add other object, say triangle, and introduce another constraint, say "square is to the left of the triangle". From the user (human) point of view, everything remains absolutely transparent.
Constraints naturally enjoy several interesting properties:
* constraints may specify partial information, i.e., constraint need not uniquely specify the values of its variables, * constraints are non-directional, typically a constraint on (say) two variables X, Y can be used to infer a constraint on X given a constraint on Y and vice versa, * constraints are declarative, i.e., they specify what relationship must hold without specifying a computational procedure to enforce that relationship, * constraints are additive, i.e., the order of imposition of constraints does not matter, all that matters at the end is that the conjunction of constraints is in effect, * constraints are rarely independent, typicaly constraints in the constraint store share variables.
Constraints arise naturally in most areas of human endeavor. The three angles of a triangle sum to 180 degrees, the sum of the currents floating into a node must equal zero, the position of the scroller in the window scrollbar must reflect the visible part of the underlying document, these are some examples of constraints which appear in the real world. Thus, constraints are a natural medium for people to express problems in many fields. Reference: http://kti.ms.mff.cuni.cz/~bartak/constraints/intro.html

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the logical_relation specifies a for the Constraint_occurrence. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: A Design_characteristic_occurrence is a type of that specifies the technical performance values and tolerances for some aspect of a design.
ext_description.note: The specifications set forth in design characteristics may include such items as enterprise or customer specifications on preferred packaging, power design and control, design rules, and preferred design practices.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Design_requirement_occurrence is a type of . A Design_requirement_occurrence may be an .

An Ee_product_definition_based_constraint_occurrence is a type of that has a basis in the characteristics of an and that identifies the basis definition. An Ee_product_definition_based_constraint_occurrence may be a .
the constraining_part specifies the for the Ee_product_definition_based_constraint_occurrence.

ext_description.p: An Requirement_definition_property is one of a , a , a , a , a , or a and additionally may be one of an , a , an or a , and additionally may be one of an or a . An Requirement_definition_property is a statement of criteria for design or manufacturing that may be derived from more abstract criteria or may be a decomposition of a technical parameter associated wtih a product structure. Complex requirements may be associated with a product specifically for the purpose of managing the requirements.
ext_description.note: This part of ISO 10303 provides generic categories for enterprise classification of requirements and includes some domain classified requirements.
ext_description.example: An inspection requirement may be derived from an electromagnetic requirement.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the reference_clause specifies the for the in a natural language. The reference_clause need not be specified for a particular .
the required_material specifies the role of the for the . The required_material need not be specified for a particular .
the required_characteristic specifies the role of the for the . There shall be one or more for an . The required_characteristic need not be specified for a particular .
the requirement_specification specifies the for the source of the . There shall be one or more for an .
the required_coordinated_characteristic specifies the role of the for an . There shall be one or more for an . The required_coordinated_characteristic need not be specified for a particular .
the required_part specifies the role of the for the . There shall be one or more for an . The required_part need not be specified for a particular .
the required_functional_specification specifies the for the . There shall be one or more for an . The required_functional_specification need not be specified for a particular .
the required_analytical_representation specifies the for the . There shall be one or more for an . The required_analytical_representation need not be specified for a particular .
the associated_definition specifies the for the .
The associated_definition shall be unique within the population of .
An Electrical_requirement_occurrence is a type of that is related to performance with respect to electrical functionality. An Electrical_requirement_occurrence may be a .
An Electromagnetic_requirement_occurrence is a type of that is related to performance with respect to electromagnetic compatibility and interference.
A Material_electrical_conductivity_requirement_occurrence is a type of that specifies the requirement for conductive material.

ext_description.p: the electrical_conductivity_characteristic specifies the for the Material_electrical_conductivity_requirement_occurrence. The electrical_conductivity_characteristic specifies either a conductive, a non_conductive, a resistive, or a semi_conductive classification of material conductivity for the .
ext_description.note: These are generic category names. If more specific data is required, the characteristics should be associated to the Material_electrical_conductivity_requirement_occurrence using the or the inherited from .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Mechanical_requirement_occurrence is a type of that specifies a mechanical bdomain related requirement.

An Operational_requirement_occurrence_relationship is the association between one and another, with a defined type of relationship. An Operational_requirement_occurrence_relationship is an incompletely modeled concept and shall be combined with members of to form a complete requirement.
the related_requirement_occurrence specifies the first for the Operational_requirement_occurrence_relationship. The first is the dependent item if the relationship is a dependency relationship.
the relating_requirement_occurrence specifies the second for the Operational_requirement_occurrence_relationship. The second is the independent item if the relationship is a dependency relationship.

the relationship_type specifies one of the following:
an AND_OPERATION
an OR_OPERATION
a DERIVED_FROM relationship The mathematical operations AND, OR shall be implemented for this relationship_type. DERIVED_FROM only asserts a dependency relationship. The AND_OPERATION is provided so that changes in relationship_type from OR_OPERATION to AND_OPERATION do not cause a structural change to the populated data. The implicit relationship between two member of that help to compose the same Requirement_group_occurrence is an AND relationship.

Each member of Operational_requirement_occurrence_relationship shall specify members of that are also specified by a member of that specifies a member of Requirement_group_occurrence as the composition or result of the operation.
A Purpose_occurrence is a type of that specifies the intended behaviour and usage of the aspect of a design for which the requirement is allocated.

ext_description.p: A Shape_and_ee_product_definition_based_constraint_occurrence is a type of that has a basis in the characteristics of one or more within the context of the inherited from . Each member of referenced shall reference the referenced by the attribute inherited from .
ext_description.note: This provides a mechanism to specify that one or more of the analysis or keepout shapes on is a constraint.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the constraining_shape specifies the role of the for the Shape_and_ee_product_definition_based_constraint_occurrence. The interpretation shall be that the constraining_shape specifies the shape representation and the inherited from the supertype specifies the . There may be one or more for the Shape_and_ee_product_definition_based_constraint_occurrence.

ext_description.p: A Structured_text_id_in_document is a set of detailed information whose location in a document is directly referenced. The information is in the form of text, tables, and graphics in a human readable language, although the hard copy may be a report from computer interpretable files. The same information may be included in multiple documents in different locations, and in that case different Structured_text_id_in_document would be populated for each document. This Application Object supports the case where it is necessary to identify the different locations within the same document that a set of information exists.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the document specifies the that is the container for the information referenced by Structured_text_id_in_document.
the text specifies the unique that is the information for the Structured_text_id_in_document.
the identifier specifies the label that is the identification within the document of the referenced by text for the Structured_text_id_in_document.

ext_description.p: A Test_requirement_occurrence is a type of that specifies a test related requirement. The test method shall be specified in the inherited from . The Test_requirement_occurrence provides a representation of minimum bounds on behaviour. In order to relate a Test_requirement_occurrence to a product, a is required to be exchanged that references this Application Object and the version of the product to which the test requirement is allocated. That shall also specify a number of in order to specify the measurement access points for the test. It is valid to exchange a Test_requirement_occurrence without a .
ext_description.note: This edition of this part of ISO 10303 does not explicitly relate the test requirement to the test setup.
The Test_requirement_occurrence may be used as a reference for .

The Test_requirement_occurrence may be a derived requirement from a , in which case production capability based margins would cause the actual characteristics to be different between the and the Test_requirement_occurrence.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: Either an shall be provided or a shall be provided.
A Thermal_requirement_occurrence is a type of that specifies a heat transfer related requirement.
